abstracts.cdata!:
Porject outcome is rated highly
            satisfactory, and sustainability is likely. Bank and
            Borrower performances both were highly satisfactory. Lessons
            learned pertaining to judicial reform were thus: Efforts to
            successfully assist judical reform processes may require
            holistic, carefully sequenced measures in order to deal with
            the sometimes closed nature and other characteristics of
            some judiciaries. The process might also involve winning the
            collaboration of diverse stakeholders and other concerned
            groups. Judicial reform efforts may also require a
            multi-faceted program. In this case, court and political
            leaders initially sought assistance for buildings,
            computers, and training. But not all envisioned or
            immediately supported the behavioral changes needed to make
            judicial output more efficient, predictable, equitable, and
            subject to transparent rules. Forcefully and transparently
            addressing problems of corruption among judges and court
            staff can make a substantial contribution to judicial
            reform, especially in countries where justice services are
            poor and inequitable. The Venezuelan authorities followed
            the Constitutional changes with measures to discharge judges
            who had been fairly criticized,televised proceedings on
            selection of new judges, and tightened disciplinary
            standards and activities. Another general lesson was for the
            Bank, as a global knowledge institution, to creatively
            leverage its contacts and expertise to involve others in partnership-and-capacity-building.

5083247.trustfund:
TF040209-EL SALVADOR - JUDICIAL REFORM.
            COURT IT STUDIES,TF037428-VENEZUELA - SUPREME COURT AND
            JUDICIAL COUNCIL,TF038039-VENEZUELA - SUPREME COURT STRGTH,TF036943-VENEZUELA - SUPREME COURT STRENGTHENING,TF036487-VENEZUELA - SUPREME COURT MODERNIZATION,TF034537-GUATEMALA - PUBLIC SECTOR MANAGEMENT,TF029603-PHRD-SUPREME COURT INST.
            STRENGTHENING PROG.,TF035722-GUATEMALA - JUDICIAL REFORM PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The Supreme Court Modernization Project
            aims at improving the performance of the Supreme Court in
            terms of transparency, efficiency of administration and case
            management, and timeliness of decisions, through development
            of new work methods, attitudes, and behavior that would have
            a demonstration effect in leading further judicial reform.
            The project consists of four components. First, the
            communications, policy research, and quality assurance
            component will provide support to develop a program to
            improve the institutional capabilities of the Supreme Court.
            Second, the caseload administration component will
            restructure the Court's internal organization, work
            practices and behavior, as well as administrative procedures
            to improve case-handling and preparation of decisions.
            Third, the Supreme Court's decision dissemination
            component will evaluate existing arrangements for
            publication of decisions, establish information kiosks, and
            train staff to develop publication capabilities. Fourth, the
            administrative and management support component will
            streamline organizational structure, computerize
            administrative support functions, institutionalize strategic
            planning, and develop monitoring and evaluation capabilities.
